Dear Bob:
I have been looking over the proposed November 18th draft
of the agreement between the NAEB and Kent State. Here are
a few reactions.
I would suggest rephrasing the first paragraph as follows
(additions or alterations are underlined for quick spotting):
"1* Kent State University would be the exclusive distributor
(other than aa indicated below) for non-broadcast
purposes ot ail taped radio programs produced under
grants from the Educational Television and Radio
Center (except those excluded in writing by the
Educational Television and Radio Center or the
National Association of Educational Broadcasters).
The producer, the eJtRcJ and the 'HAES shall each also
have the right to make its own distribution from
time to time, when warranted by justifiable circum¬
stances.”
I should assume that "Kent State University" Is singular;
if so, then 1A should read "Kent State University will charge its....*
I am not quite clear as to need for point IB. Why should
they list any programs In their catalog except those which they
distribute? And don*t the other sections of this agreement
indicate which of our programs they can distribute? This I
think should be sharpened up or omitted.
In paragraph 2, reference is made to the fact that the
programs will be "coded" by Kent State University. Here again
I am not quite clear as to the purpose of the statement. Why do
we care whether or not they are "coded"?
